newsitem.title: UK: Arbitrator may review Railtrack charges-paper.
newsitem.headline: Arbitrator may review Railtrack charges-paper.

text.p: Railtrack Plc is likely to have its track access charges reviewed by an independent arbitrator after complaints from train operating companies that performance payments are too high, the Independent said on Friday.

Railtrack has been targeted by train operators after its accounts revealed bonus payments of 29 million stg for last year because it had exceeded performance targets, the paper said. That compared with a 43 million stg penalty the year before.

Connex South Central believes the benchmark year for the performance regime was set too low, and was charged far more than it expected. Although the number of minutes lost to train delays has improved by 38 percent, Connex has paid out nearly 10 million stg to Railtrack, the paper said.
The two sides are talking through the disputes resolution committee. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
